ch.iserver.ace.collaboration.jupiter.server
Interface PublisherPort

All Superinterfaces:
ParticipantPort
All Known Implementing Classes:
PublisherPortImpl
public interface PublisherPort
extends ParticipantPort

A PublisherPort extends the ParticipantPort interface with methods available to the publisher of a document. The publisher has additional rights, which are not available to normal participants.

Method Summary
 void invite(RemoteUser user)
          Invites the given user to the session.
 void kick(int participantId)
          Allows the publisher part of the Collaboration Layer to kick a participant from the session.
 void setDocumentDetails(DocumentDetails details)
          Sets the new document details for the session.
 
Methods inherited from interface ch.iserver.ace.net.ParticipantPort
getParticipantId, leave, receiveAcknowledge, receiveCaretUpdate, receiveRequest
 

Method Detail

kick

void kick(int participantId)
Allows the publisher part of the Collaboration Layer to kick a participant from the session. Kicked users are no longer part of the session and do not receive messages anymore.

Parameters:
participantId - the participant to kick

invite

void invite(RemoteUser user)
Invites the given user to the session.

Parameters:
user - the user to be invited

setDocumentDetails

void setDocumentDetails(DocumentDetails details)
Sets the new document details for the session.

Parameters:
details - the new document details
